result.execSummary:
The defendant Oswald T. Mattner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Oswald T. Mattner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Oswald T. Mattner was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Oswald T. Mattner was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 117 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $2,095.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Jenifer Wieczorek or her residence, her place of employment or school, or with any of her family members, directly, by 3rd party, or in any other way, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review hearing 8/16/15 @ 830am to see if restitution has been paid.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim appeared by phone and gave statement.  On ct 2 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions; on ct 5 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions concurrent to ct 2; credit for 117 days served if revoked; restitution ordered in the amount of $2,095.00 (by stipulation of deft); pay $450 DNA surcharge, pay $100 DV surcharge; any proceeds from sale of truck to be paid toward restitution.  RH set for 8/16/16 at 8:30am to see if restituiton paid.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Delgado requests to adjourn SEH to determine what actual restitution would be.  SEH continued to 8/13/15 at 3:30pm; issue of restitution, where deft intends to reside and work to be addressed.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed, ct 6 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 2 & 5.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 5.  PSI ordered.  DNA surcharge ordered.  SEH 8/6/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Kraus. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KSD Deputy Stuart Schwerdtfeger sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Perz. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Perz. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-3-15 @ 8:30am.  Bond continued.
